author: George Orwell
summary: A bleak future where the Party monitors every thought. Winston Smith quietly resists Big Brother, seeking truth and love while propaganda and fear suffocate society.

title: The Hobbit
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
summary: Comfort‑loving Bilbo Baggins is swept into a quest with dwarves to reclaim a stolen treasure from the dragon Smaug. Along the road he discovers wit, bravery, and unlikely allies.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J. K. Rowling
summary: An orphan learns he is a wizard and enters a school of magic. With new friends he faces trials and a dark foe tied to his past.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
summary: A humble hobbit inherits a ring of terrible power. A fellowship forms to carry it south and destroy it before it corrupts the world.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: Through Scout Finch’s eyes, a small Southern town confronts prejudice when her father defends a Black man falsely accused. A warm, sharp tale about conscience and compassion.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: Elizabeth Bennet clashes with the aloof Mr. Darcy in a witty dance of pride and misunderstanding. Sharp social satire meets slow‑burn romance.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: Nick Carraway observes the glitter and emptiness of Jazz‑Age Long Island. Jay Gatsby’s grand love and reinvention lead to tragic unraveling.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: Captain Ahab drives his crew across vast oceans to hunt the white whale that maimed him. A sprawling meditation on purpose and madness.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A shepherd follows recurring dreams from Spain to Egypt, learning to read omens and trust his heart. A simple parable about purpose and courage.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
summary: A father and son trek through a burned America, guarding a fragile flame of kindness. Sparse prose, stark danger, and fierce love.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
summary: On desert planet Arrakis, noble houses fight over the spice. Young Paul Atreides is thrust into politics, prophecy, and guerrilla survival among the Fremen.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
summary: A washed‑up hacker is hired for a near‑impossible cyberspace heist. Neon noir, jacked‑in action, and the birth of cyberpunk style.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
summary: Kvothe recounts how a gifted street urchin became a notorious arcanist. Music, magic, and mystery in a patient, lyrical fantasy.

title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
author: Brandon Sanderson
summary: A street crew led by a gifted girl takes on an immortal tyrant using Allomancy—metal‑based powers. Heist energy meets epic revolution.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
summary: A disgraced journalist and a brilliant hacker dig into a wealthy family’s secrets. Cold cases, corporate rot, and a fierce, enigmatic heroine.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
summary: When Amy disappears, suspicion falls on her husband. Twisty, toxic, and razor‑sharp about the stories we tell about ourselves.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
summary: A symbologist races across Europe to solve a murder tied to art history. Puzzles, chases, and conspiracies galore.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
summary: Stranded on Mars, an astronaut hacks botany and engineering to stay alive. Wry logs, hard science, and relentless problem‑solving.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
summary: In Gilead, fertile women are forced into servitude. Offred fights to retain identity and memory under a theocratic regime.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: A glossy future trades freedom for comfort through genetic castes and pleasure drugs. One outsider questions the cost of stability.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
summary: Fireman Guy Montag burns books until curiosity sparks rebellion. A parable about thinking freely in a numbing media age.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
summary: A Kabul childhood friendship is shattered; years later, a man seeks to make amends across borders and wars.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
summary: Shipwrecked with a Bengal tiger, Pi must survive at sea. A fable about belief and the stories we choose.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
summary: In Nazi Germany, a girl steals books and shares them with neighbors and a hidden refugee. Death narrates with haunting warmth.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
summary: A mysterious circus appears without warning, stage for a duel between two magicians who fall in love. Dreamy, atmospheric wonder.

title: The Shadow of the Wind
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
summary: In postwar Barcelona, a boy protects a forgotten novel from being erased. Labyrinthine intrigue through libraries and alleys.

title: The Silmarillion
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
summary: Myths of Middle‑earth: the forging of the world, the pride of elves and men, and the ancient wars against darkness.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R. R. Martin
summary: Noble houses vie for a fragile throne while a colder threat gathers in the North. Brutal politics and tangled loyalties.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
summary: Through letters, Celie finds strength, love, and self‑worth amid hardship in the American South.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
summary: A formerly enslaved woman is haunted by the past—literally and figuratively. Lyrical, devastating, and humane.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
summary: Earth is demolished for a hyperspace bypass; a hapless human hitchhikes the universe with a towel and a sardonic guidebook.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
summary: A mathematician predicts empire’s fall and seeds a plan to shorten the dark age. Big ideas over generations.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
summary: A gifted boy trains through war games to face an alien threat, only to learn a shattering truth about victory.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A beautiful young man never ages while his hidden portrait rots with sin. A witty, sinister tale of self‑indulgence.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
summary: Told through journals and letters, a vampire from Transylvania preys upon Victorian London. Atmosphere, dread, and brave pursuit.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
summary: A scientist stitches life from death, then recoils from his creation. A tragic dialogue between maker and made.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
summary: Caretakers of an empty hotel for winter, a family unravels as the building’s hungry history wakes up.

title: It
author: Stephen King
summary: A circle of friends faces a shapeshifting evil that feeds on fear—first as kids, then decades later as adults.

title: The Pillars of the Earth
author: Ken Follett
summary: In medieval England, the building of a cathedral entangles lives in politics, love, and rivalry over decades.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
summary: A sweeping narrative of Homo sapiens—from foragers to empires—arguing that shared fictions knit large societies.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
summary: Raised by survivalists with no formal schooling, a young woman pursues education to understand and rebuild her life.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
summary: Tiny, consistent improvements compound. Practical frameworks for designing habits and environments that stick.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
summary: Nobel laureate explains two modes of thought—fast and intuitive, slow and analytical—and how they mislead our choices.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
summary: Build‑measure‑learn: a method to test ideas quickly, pivot with data, and avoid waste when creating new products.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andrew Hunt & David Thomas
summary: Timeless advice for developers: treat code as craft, automate prudently, write clearly, and keep learning.

title: The Design of Everyday Things
author: Don Norman
summary: Why everyday objects confuse us—and how to fix them. A classic on designing for how people really think and act.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
summary: Explores the loop that drives habits in people and organizations, with stories and strategies for change.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
summary: A blunt argument for choosing what truly matters and accepting constraints, rather than chasing constant positivity.

title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
summary: Ancient aphorisms on planning, terrain, and morale. A military manual with enduring lessons for competition.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
summary: An envoy on an icy world must trust a native ally in a society without fixed gender. Political intrigue and deep empathy.
